Details: Metazoa without tissue organization are called Parazoa.
In Parazoa, ectoderm develops from vegetal pore while endoderm develops from animal pore (reverse of Metazoa).
Introduction.Evolution: Sponges form the sideline of evolution.

John Ellis: Animal nature of Sponge was discovered by John Ellis.

Inner layer/ Choanoderm/ Gastral epithel: Choanocytes or Collar cells are only present in Sponges.
Water current through the body of sponge is maintained by Choanocytes.
Choanocytes help in Nutrition by ingesting food through the incoming water (holozoically).
The cavity common to all sponges is Spongocoel or Paragastric cavity lined with flagellated choanocytes.

Description: Sponges have a canal system also known as Water Canal System or Aquiferous system.
Canal system is a characteristic feature of Sponges.
Sponges need a continuous current of water flowing through their bodies for Nutrition, Respiration, Excretion, and Reproduction.

data: 1. Incurrent canal is lined by Pinacocytes. 2. Prosopyle is lined by Porocyte. 3. Radial canals are lined by Choanocytes.
1. Incurrent canal is lined by Pinacocytes. 2. Prosopyle is lined by Porocyte. 3. Radial canals are lined by Choanocytes.
Rhagon is Leucon type of Canal system found in some larval stages and will be transformed to Leucon type during adulthood.

Regeneration Capacity.General: All Porifera without exception show high power of Regeneration.
Regeneration Capacity.Reasons: Due to archaeocytes which are highly totipotent cells.

Morpholaxis: Each cut piece grows into a new organism.

Nutrition.Digestion: Intracellular and holozoic. Takes place partially in choanocytes and partially in wandering amoebocytes. Digestion of food takes place in Food vacuoles.
Nutrition.Respiration: Performed by both Choanoderm and Body surface, but mainly by Choanoderm.
Nutrition.Circulation: Takes place by Wandering of Amoebocyte cells.
Nutrition.Excretion and Gas Exchange: Primarily Ammonia; Simple diffusion occurs across the Choanoderm.

Reproduction.General: Porifera reproduces by both Asexual and Sexual methods.

Internal Bud (Gemmule): Formed by the aggregation of Archaeocytes.
Gemmulation is the process of forming internal bud.

Sexual Reproduction: Porifera are Bisexual/Monoecious (‚ö§) and Protogynous (Female gametes mature first).
Cleavage of zygote is Holoblastic (Complete division) and Equal.
Larva is active and floating but adult is sedentary and sessile.

data: Short-lived stages formed when the colony becomes attached to a Substrate.

General: Radial symmetrical (except Sycon, Leucosolenia, and Larva of Sponges)

Grades of Organization: Sponges have Cellular grade of Organization.
